My research contributes to Sustainable Development Goal 3 by advancing data-driven approaches in health and biomedical sciences. Through the integration of bioinformatics, transcriptomics, epigenetics, and biomaterials research, my work supports the development and evaluation of regenerative strategies, particularly in bone tissue engineering. By focusing on in vitro models and predictive computational pipelines, I aim to improve the understanding of cell–material interactions and to generate robust biomarkers that can ultimately support safer, more effective, and more sustainable healthcare solutions.



Aligned with Sustainable Development Goal 4, I am actively engaged in promoting quality education through scientific training, capacity building, and open educational resources. I develop and deliver workshops, short courses, and teaching materials focused on bioinformatics, data science, and reproducible research practices. By emphasizing computational literacy and critical data analysis, my work supports the formation of highly qualified students and researchers, contributing to inclusive and lifelong learning in science and technology.



My work directly supports Sustainable Development Goal 9 by contributing to scientific innovation and digital research infrastructure. I develop scalable computational workflows, machine learning–based analytical strategies, and interoperable data resources that integrate physical, chemical, and biological datasets. These efforts strengthen research infrastructure and foster innovation at the interface of biology, materials science, and data science, enabling more efficient knowledge generation and supporting the translation of scientific advances into technological and industrial applications.

title: Marcel Ferreira’s Lab
text:
Our laboratory is dedicated to innovation and excellence in biotechnology and bioinformatics, exploring the frontiers of science to address pressing research challenges.
Marcel Ferreira, is a Medical Physics graduate with a Master’s and Ph.D. in Biotechnology from the Institute of Biosciences of Botucatu (IBB) at São Paulo State University (UNESP). He is a postdoctoral researcher in the Molecular Genetics and Bioinformatics Laboratory (GemBio), led by Prof. Dr. Erick da Cruz Castelli, where he develops methodologies for whole-genome sequencing using Oxford Nanopore technology and advanced bioinformatics strategies for data analysis. Marcel also collaborates closely with the Laboratory of Bioassays and Cell Dynamics (LaBIO), directed by Prof. Dr. Willian Fernando Zambuzzi, contributing to research in tissue mineralization biology, biomaterials, and biotechnology.
Our laboratory integrates diverse expertise to pursue impactful discoveries. We invite you to explore our work, learn about our ongoing projects, and collaborate with us to advance the boundaries of science.

title: Marcel Ferreira’s Lab
Marcel Ferreira’s Lab
text:
Expertises
At the Marcel Ferreira Laboratory, we excel in integrating diverse scientific approaches to address complex biological questions. Our specializations include:

Bioinformatics 
Expertise in analyzing genomics, transcriptomics, proteomics, and epigenetics data. We leverage cutting-edge tools and algorithms to decode the intricate mechanisms of life.
Data Analysis and Statistics 
Proficient in designing and executing robust data analysis pipelines, ensuring accurate interpretation of complex datasets across various scientific disciplines.
Oxford Nanopore Sequencing Data 
Advanced skills in analyzing Oxford Nanopore sequencing data, from quality control to genome assembly and variant calling, providing comprehensive insights into genetic landscapes.
Bone Biomaterials 
Skilled in the synthesis and characterization of bone biomaterials, with a focus on their physicochemical properties and biological interactions to advance regenerative medicine.
Machine Learning 
Application of machine learning techniques to predict outcomes, classify datasets, and uncover patterns in biological and material science data, pushing the boundaries of innovation.

Our multidisciplinary expertise allows us to approach challenges holistically, fostering impactful discoveries and innovative solutions.
